body.p: CASE 167.—Private I. Conduri, Co. D, 1st Michigan Cavalry, aged 22 years, was shot in the right thigh while on scout near Culpeper, April 24, 1864. He was admitted to the Third Division Hospital, Alexandria, whence Surgeon E. Bentley, U. S. V., reported: "The treatment consisted of water dressings, tonics, stimulants, and extra diet. The patient died June 11, 1864. The post-mortem showed that the ball entered the thigh at its middle third, on its anterior aspect, passed upward and entirely through the articulation of the hip joint, and lodged in the body of the sacrum."
